info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 7:47PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN MERCER COUNTY THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Adamsville, or 14 miles north of Sharpsville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Jamestown, Sheakleyville, and Maurice K Goddard State Park. This includes Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 135 and 137. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
